ABBREVIATION.Defintion: a short form of a word or phrase

ASHORE.Defintion: towards or onto land from an area of water

BACKSTORIES.Defintion: the things that have happened to someone before you first see or read about that person in a film or story

CONCRETE.Defintion: clear and certain, or real and existing in a form that can be seen or felt

DAMSEL.Defintion: a young woman who is not married

DEFINITIVE.Defintion: firm, final, and complete; not to be questioned or changed

DESIRABLE.Defintion: worth having and wanted by most people

ETYMOLOGIES.Defintion: the study of the origin and history of words, or a study of this type relating to one particular word

ETYMOLOGY.Defintion: the study of the origin and history of words, or a study of this type relating to one particular word

EVOLVES.Defintion: to develop gradually, or to cause something or someone to develop gradually

GOBLIN.Defintion: (in stories) a small, ugly creature that is harmful to humans

HERMAPHRODITE.Defintion: a plant, animal, or person with both male and female sex organs

LEGEND HAS IT.Defintion: used to refer to something that is generally thought to be true although not official or known to be a fact

MORPHED.Defintion: to gradually change, or change someone or something, from one thing to another

MUTINOUS.Defintion: (especially of a sailor or a soldier) refusing to obey orders or attempting to take control from people in authority

NONSENSE.Defintion: an idea, something said or written, or behaviour that is silly or stupid

NORSE.Defintion: a North Germanic language once spoken in Scandinavia, the Faroe Islands, Iceland, Greenland, and in parts of Russia, France and the British Isles and Ireland. It was the language of the Vikings or Norsemen

OBLITERATE.Defintion: to remove all signs of something, either by destroying it or by covering it so that it cannot be seen

PURISTS.Defintion: someone who believes in and follows very traditional rules or ideas in a subject

RAVAGING.Defintion: to cause great damage to something

ROOTS.Defintion: the origin or source of something

RUFFLED A FEW FEATHERS.Defintion: to cause someone to be upset

SYMPTOMS.Defintion: any feeling of illness or physical or mental change that is caused by a particular disease

TRACE.Defintion: to find the origin of something

UNIQUE.Defintion: being the only existing one of its type or, more generally, unusual, or special in some way
